dta.Centroid¶

class dta.Centroid(id, x, y, label=None, level=None)¶

Bases: dta.Node.Node

A Node subclass that represents a centroid node in a network.

__init__(id, x, y, label=None, level=None)¶

Constructor.

  • id is a unique identifier (unique within the containing network), an integer
  • x and y are coordinates (what units?)
  • label is a string, for readability. If None passed, will default to “label [id]”
  • level is for vertical alignment. More details TBD. If None passed, will use default.

Methods

__init__ x.__init__(...) initializes x; see x.__class__.__doc__ for signature
Centroid.addIncomingLink
Centroid.addOutgoingLink
getCardinality()¶

Return a pair of numbers representing the number of incoming and outgoing links respectively

getId()¶

Returns the integer id for this node.

getIncomingLinkForId(linkId)¶

Returns True if there is an incoming link with the given id

getIncomingLinkForNodeId(nodeId)¶

Returns True if there is an incoming link starting from nodeId

getMovement(upNodeId, downNodeId)¶

Return the movement from upNodeId to downNodeId that goes through this node

getName()¶

Return the name of the intersection as a string consisting of the labels of the incoming links in sorted order.

getNumAdjacentLinks()¶

Return the number of links adjacent to this node (either incoming or outgoing)

getNumAdjacentNodes()¶

Return the number of nodes that are connected to this node.

getNumAdjacentRoadLinks()¶

Return the number of RoadLinks adjacent to this node (either incoming or outgoing)

getNumAdjacentRoadNodes()¶

Return the number of nodes that are connected to this node.

getNumAttachedConnectors()¶

Return the number of connectors attached to this Centroid

getNumIncomingConnectors()¶

Return the number of incoming connectors

getNumIncomingLinks()¶

Returns the number of incoming links

getNumMovements()¶

Return the number of movements associated with this node

getNumOutgoingConnectors()¶

Return the number of outgoing connectors

getNumOutgoingLinks()¶

Retruns the number of outoing links

getStreetNames()¶

Return the street names of the incoming links as a list

getX()¶

Returns the x-coordinate for this node.

getY()¶

Returns the y-coordinate for this node.

hasConnector()¶

Return True if there is a connector atached to the node.

hasIncomingLinkForId(linkId)¶

Returns True if there is an incoming link with the given id

hasIncomingLinkForNodeId(nodeId)¶

Returns True if there is an incoming link starting from nodeId

hasMovement(startNodeId, endNodeId)¶

Return True if the node has movement from startNodeId to endNodeId

hasOutgoingLinkForId(linkId)¶

Returns True if there is an outgoing link wwith the given id

hasOutgoingLinkForNodeId(nodeId)¶

Returns True if there is a link towards the given node id

isCentroid()¶

Return True if this Node is a Centroid

isConnectedToRoadNode(roadNode)¶

Return True if there is a virtual link and a connetor that connect to the roadNode

isIntersection()¶

Return True if this node is an intersection

isJunction()¶

Return True if this node is a junction.

isRoadNode()¶

Return True if this Node is a RoadNode.

isShapePoint(countRoadNodesOnly=False)¶

Return True if the node is a shape point (e.g. Node 51245 in the following graph). If countRoadNodesOnly is True the method will count only RoadLinks attached to this Node and will disregard an connectors.

isVirtualNode()¶

Return True if this Node is a VirtualNode

iterAdjacentConnectors()¶

Return True if there is a virtual link and a connetor that connect to the roadNode

iterAdjacentLinks()¶

Return an iterator to all links adjacent (incoming or outgoing) to this node

iterAdjacentNodes()¶

Return an iterator to the adjacent Nodes

iterAdjacentRoadLinks()¶

Return an iterator to all RoadLinks adjacent to this Node (excluding Connectors)

iterAdjacentRoadNodes()¶

Return an iterator to all RoadNodes adjacent to this Node

iterDownstreamNodes()¶

Returns an iterator to the downstream nodes

iterIncomingLinks()¶

Returns iterator for the incoming links.

iterMovements()¶

Return an iterator to all the movements going through the node

iterOutgoingLinks()¶

Returns iterator for the outgoing links.

iterUpstreamNodes()¶

Returns an iterator to the upstream nodes
